author: Ben Lee
title: X-Men Apocalypse's Michael Fassbender made Bryan Singer cry during filming - Movies
text: Get the tissues ready if you go and see X-Men: Apocalypse next year, because Michael Fassbender apparently delivered a killer moment.Director Bryan Singer talked about the upcoming superhero movie at this year's San Pedro International Film Festival, and revealed Fassbender actually made him cry."Michael Fassbender did something so wonderful in this movie," he said."Fassbender does something in this movie where we're at the end of the scene, and he asked me not to call cut. And when the scene was over, he continued and did something that made me cry in the tent. I've never done that before."The head of my company, Jason Taylor, grabbed a Kleenex. Simon Kinberg, the writer who has no emotions at all, actually became emotional. © 20th Century Fox "It was so beautiful. I've never seen an actor do this for me, and he just took the scene to a whole another level."It's a heartbreaking scene, not a typical comic book movie scene at all, so let's hope it makes the cut."But after he did it, I went up to him and I hugged him and I said, 'Michael, thank you for that gift. Now I need you to do it again'. And he did it, and f**king rocked it again with full emotion. This guy is amazing." © Amanda Edwards/Getty Images for HRC.org Singer also teased that X-Men: Apocalypse will likely be the longest in the series so far, "wrapping up" six movies at the same time.X-Men Apocalypse is scheduled for May 19, 2016 in the UK and May 27 in the US.
